column4: big trouble here ... I did update a few packages (sshd was one of them) on my ubuntu 10.04 vserver and now the sshd does no start anymore :-(
no console but I still have access to the filesystem
That makes is kind of hard to diagnose..
Could you try to chroot into your server file system and try to start sshd by hand? Maybe it will give some useful output..
indeed it does ... feels like printf debugging
vserver .. all I have is the filesystem ... so I can access logs and configs ... but that's it
I wonder if you can grep your logs for output from sshd
already did ... first I had trouble with the ttys respawning over and over again ... move those files init.d event files away
Did you customize your SSH server in some way?
nope ... which is why I went for the maintainer's version on install
tried to sneak in the sshd startup into the cron startup (which does start) but that did not work for some reason
only got init, udevd, cron and syslog running ... no other processes
I was thinking you can run 'sshd' the command with verbose.
run where?
Find 'sshd' the executable and run it via a command line?
well ... I don't have ssh access to that machine anymore - that is the problem :)
all I got is filesystem level access
I need ssh to log SOME sort of error in the syslogs.. else it's hard to tell...
Or you can read the ssh logs.. or messages from your /var/log
I can ... but nothing in there
No mention of sshd?
nope ... looked in daemon.log and syslog.log
Please have a look at messages
cleaned out the logs to see changes ... but messages did not get re-created ... so I guess that means nothing did get posted for "messages"
